decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The size, scale and positioning of the side extension would result in the loss of original features which would harm the appearance of the pair of listed property. It would also harm the living conditions of neighbours. It is therefore considered to conflict with adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), and H.6.4 (Extensions and Alterations), ENV-B.2.2 (Conservation Areas) and ENV-B.2.7 (Alterations to listed buildings and buildings of local townscape character) and the intent of the Residential Extension Guidelines
The design of the single storey rear extension would be harmful to the appearance of a pair of listed buildings and to the character and appearance of the Bedford Park Conservation Area. It would also harm neighbours' living conditions through loss of privacy. It is therefore considered to conflict with adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), and H.6.4 (Extensions and Alterations), ENV-B.2.2 (Conservation Areas) and ENV-B.2.7 (Alterations to listed buildings and buildings of local townscape character) and the intent of the Residential Extension Guidelines.
The roof extension and internal alterations would fail to preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the listed building. It would result in undue loss of original features and would conflict with adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), and H.6.4 (Extensions and Alterations), ENV-B.2.2 (Conservation Areas) and ENV-B.2.7 (Alterations to listed buildings and buildings of local townscape character) and the intent of the Residential Extension Guidelines.
description: Demolition of existing garage and replace with a single storey side extension, rebuild existing single storey rear extension, addition of a window to rear roofslope, Along with internal and external works including creation of new openings and adaption of existing openings and reconfiguration of internal layout.
